```py
>>> import numpy.ma as ma
>>> a = np.arange(9).reshape((3,3))
>>> a = ma.array(a)
>>> a[1, 0] = ma.masked
>>> a[1, 2] = ma.masked
>>> a[2, 1] = ma.masked
>>> a
masked_array(
 data=[[0, 1, 2],
 [--, 4, --],
 [6, --, 8]],
 mask=[[False, False, False],
 [ True, False,  True],
 [False,  True, False]],
 fill_value=999999)
>>> ma.count_masked(a)
3 
```

```py
>>> ma.count_masked(a, axis=0)
array([1, 1, 1])
>>> ma.count_masked(a, axis=1)
array([0, 2, 1]) 
```
